page.title: 19Sand Extraction, Austerfield
page.content: The soil throughout the block is box sand. It is a glacial deposit from the last Ice Age and occurs in a wedge shaped area fanning south from Doncaster to beyond Bawtry. This deposit is the largest in the United Kingdom and is of the best quality. It is used by the Black Top industry in the manufacture of hot rolled asphalt and also in the building of virtually all local houses. The quarries are situated to the east of Austerfield with access on to the A614 and thus heavy lorries make up a large proportion of the traffic through the village.The worked areas are extensively colonised by wild plants,including sallow trees, and such animals as toads, frogs, butterflies and moths.
